data.title: Pakistan Super League Draft, 2024: All you need to know
data.meta_description: Ahead of the player draft for the 2024 Pakistan Super League, The Cricketer explains who's involved and how it will work | The Cricketer
data.text:
What is it?

The draft for the ninth season of the Pakistan Super League.

When will the draft take place?

The draft will take place on December 13. The exact time is yet to be disclosed.

In what order will teams pick their players and how does it work?

Following confirmation of the retentions, the PCB clarified the pick order for the PSL draft, with Multan Sultans selecting first from the platinum category.

They will be followed by Karachi Kings, who didn't retain a single player in the top bracket, followed by two picks for last season's sixth-place finishers Quetta Gladiators, either side of Peshawar Zalmi.

Defending champions Lahore Qalandars will then get successive picks in the platinum category before Islamabad United get their first selection.

The order is generally dictated by the finishing position of each of the six franchises in the previous season but is tinkered with once retentions are confirmed.

Kings were moved into the first position after Sultans and Gladiators traded Iftikhar Ahmed and Rilee Rossouw. Furthermore, Naseem Shah's move to United saw them swap a first-round pick with Quetta Gladiators' third pick.

Shan Masood's switch to Karachi Kings, saw their first-round Silver pick exchanged for Multan Sultans' fourth-round Silver pick. Imad Wasim's move to Islamabad United led to their first-round silver pick being exchanged with Karachi's second-round silver pick.

Kings and Gladiators will be required to pick a local player in the Platinum category.

While the selections are ongoing, each of the six sides will have the Right to Match Card that will allow them to pick any player released from their roster before the draft.

In the pre-determined order, teams will each have the opportunity to add to their squads until all 12 categories are complete.

PSL player draft order (PSL/Twitter)

Which overseas players are available at platinum price?

Australia: Daniel Sams, Ashton Agar

Afghanistan: Fazalhaq Farooqi, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Noor Ahmad, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Hazratullah Zazai, Naveen-ul-Haq

England: Ben Duckett, Chris Jordan, David Willey, Dawid Malan, Luke Wood, Reece Topley, Tom Curran, Tymal Mills, Jamie Overton, Sam Billings, Saqib Mahmood, Tom Banton

Ireland: Josh Little

Nepal: Sandeep Lamichhane

New Zealand: James Neesham, Colin de Grandhomme

South Africa: Rassie van der Dussen, Imran Tahir, Dwaine Pretorius

Sri Lanka: Maheesh Theekshana, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Dasun Shanaka, Angelo Mathews, Kusal Mendis

West Indies: Kieron Pollard, Romario Shepherd, Brandon King, Sherfane Rutherford, Kyle Mayers, Akeal Hosein, Alzarri Joseph, Carlos Brathwaite, Evin Lewis, Keemo Paul, Obed McCoy

Imran Tahir is among the overseas players in the platinum category (ASIF HASSAN/AFP via Getty Images)

Which other overseas players have entered the draft?

An international flavour will be added to the player draft courtesy of the 485 star names that have entered themselves across the various categories.

Currently, 46 players (26 named above) have entered the platinum category, with the remainder spread across the diamond, gold and silver sections. According to the PCB, 76 players are part of the secondary diamond category.

Which players have been retained?

Islamabad United: Shadab Khan, Naseem Shah (both Platinum), Imad Wasim, Azam Khan (both Diamond), Faheem Ashraf (Brand Ambassador), Alex Hales, Colin Munro (all Gold), Rumman Raees (Silver)

Karachi Kings: James Vince, Hasan Ali (Diamond), Shan Masood (Brand Ambassador), Shoaib Malik (Mentor), Tabraiz Shamsi (all Gold), Mir Hamza, Muhammad Akhlaq (both Silver), Muhammad Irfan Khan (Emerging)

Lahore Qalandars: Shaheen Shah Afridi (Platinum), Haris Rauf (Brand Ambassador), David Wiese (both Diamond), Sikandar Raza, Abdullah Shafique, Zaman Khan (all Gold), Mirza Tahir Baig, Rashid Khan (both Silver)

Multan Sultans: Mohammad Rizwan, Iftikhar Ahmed (both Platinum), Khushdil Shah, Usama Mir (both Diamond), Abbas Afridi (Gold), Ihsanullah (Brand Ambassador, Silver), Faisal Akram (Emerging)

Peshawar Zalmi: Babar Azam, Rovman Powell (both Platinum), Saim Ayub, Tom Kohler-Cadmore (all Diamond), Mohammad Haris (Brand Ambassador) and Aamir Jamal (both Gold), Khurram Shahzad (Silver), Haseebullah (Emerging)

Quetta Gladiators: Rilee Rossouw (Platinum), Mohammad Wasim Jnr, Jason Roy and Wanindu Hasaranga (all Diamond), Sarfaraz Ahmed (Brand Ambassador) Abrar Ahmed and Mohammad Hasnain (all Gold), Will Smeed (Silver)

Shan Masood has moved to Karachi Kings (ARIF ALI/AFP via Getty Images)

How can I watch the PSL draft?

The PSL draft can be watched on the Pakistan Super League YouTube channel

When does the tournament start?

The 2024 has a tentative start date of February 8, running to the final on March 24 - but these dates have not been confirmed.
